interviewerDialogs.DialogText: Good {{greetingTime}} {{personName}}! Thank you so much for coming in. My name is {{interviewerName}}, and I am the supervisor for this department
alternates: My name is {{interviewerName}}, and I am the supervisor for this department.
My name is {{interviewerName}}, and I am the department supervisor.

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: Before getting into some questions about the position, tell me, do you have any past work experience?
alternates: Have you had any other jobs before this interview?
What other jobs have you worked before?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: Great. What did you best like about the job?
alternates: What did you learn from this experience?
What was one thing you learned from this job experience?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: What challenges did you face?
alternates: What do you think was challenging about the job?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: Why are you interested in working at our company?
alternates: How did you hear about our company?
what made you want to apply for this position?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: What do you think a QA Analyst does?

Quality assurance or QA analysts are responsible for the final step in the development of a game, website or any software product before it is released to the public. QA analysts look for flaws and weaknesses in the program.
Would this type of work be something you are interested in doing?
We'd like to know a little more about you. What are three things that are unique about you?
alternates: Tell me 3 things about you that you believe are unique.
What are your interests or hobbies?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: How would you feel about a supervisor telling you that there is an area you need to improve on? Would you feel able to take the feedback and make a positive change?
alternates: If your supervisor told you that you could improve in an area, will you be able to take that feedback and make a positive change?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText:
In terms of technical skills, how would you rate yourself on a scale of 1 to 5? 1 would be “I can log onto my computer and check my email.” 
5 would be “I can troubleshoot software, hardware and application issues. I can figure out a solution to just about anything.”
alternates:
1 would be “I can log onto my computer and check my email.” 
5 would be “I can troubleshoot software, hardware and application issues. I can figure out a solution to just about anything.”

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: Why did you choose to rate yourself that?
Would you be happy in a position where you are spending more than five hours a day working on a computer?
If you found yourself stuck on a technical issue or an equipment problem, how would you go about finding a solution?
alternates: How would you go about finding a solution to a technical problem?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: Do you feel that you could make it to work 90% of the time?
What would keep you from being here regularly?
How do you feel about sitting close to someone else or sharing a space (or equipment)?
Are you able to focus when there are conversations  or noises near you? If not, do you have strategies to help you refocus?
Do you feel comfortable with jokes or joking around with coworkers?
What are your best personal attributes?
alternates: Can you tell me your 3 best personal attributes?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: How do you feel when working under a deadline?
Are you able to recognize when you need a break?
alternates: Can you recognize when you need a break?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: How would you get to this place? Do you have a driver's license?
alternates: Will you be driving to work everyday?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: How would you feel on your commute?
alternates: Would you expect to get to Aspiritech ready to work?

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: That was the last question of this interview, please fill out this survey!
alternates: Thanks for coming in. Enjoy the rest of the day!
It was great meeting you today. Thank you for coming in.

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: Alright, Do you have any questions for me about the job or our organization?
thank you for coming in today, please have a great day!
alternates: Thanks for coming in. Enjoy the rest of the day!
It was great meeting you today. Thank you for coming in.

interviewerDialogs.DialogText: I'm sorry but we need to move on
